{"step_by_step_thinking": "Thecal sac is a membranous sheath that surrounds the spinal cord. The term 'Empty Thecal Sac' sign refers to a condition where the thecal sac appears empty on imaging studies. From the provided documents, it is clear that this sign is associated with Arachnoiditis, a condition characterized by inflammation of the arachnoid, one of the membranes that surround and protect the nerves of the central nervous system, including the brain and spinal cord. Document [22] specifically mentions that in arachnoiditis, there is an 'empty thecal sac' appearance.", "answer_choice": "A"}
